name: NPR
text:
A New York City police officer has been suspended after video appeared to show him using a chokehold during an arrest. 

Chokeholds have been banned in the city since 1993, and a new state law making it a felony was signed this month.
https://t.co/xH5gfiECvd

name: NPR
text:
The director Joel Schumacher, known for his hit '80s movies "The Lost Boys" and "St. Elmo's Fire," died Monday morning in New York City from cancer. He was 80 years old.
https://t.co/cT8TqJU7qT

name: NPR
text:
The FBI has joined the investigation into who left a noose in the racetrack garage of Bubba Wallace — the only Black driver in NASCAR's top circuit.

NASCAR plans to ban the perpetrators from the sport for life. 
https://t.co/txEwaKs4Ig

name: NPR
text:
Black Americans enrolled in Medicare were hospitalized with COVID-19 at rates nearly four times higher than their white counterparts, according to new federal data.

Disparities were also striking among Hispanics and Asian Americans.
https://t.co/tWjiL5rFqx

name: NPR
text:
Data shows police officers “regardless of their race” have similar implicit biases — especially about Black people.

"We can't make the assumption that simply because a person is Black that they're going to know about the neighborhood," says a researcher. https://t.co/12KP6Pf7Ci

name: NPR
text:
A Barcelona opera reopened with a performance of Giacomo Puccini's "Crisantemi" for a full house — of plants.
https://t.co/gIhW52O2wB

name: NPR
text:
Sudan Archives is a truly singular artist — inspired by Irish and African music, especially Sudanese music. Watch her songs, backed by violin and cello, take on new meaning.
https://t.co/kPxq7eRCEO
